page.title: 02Population of Ousden
page.content: Out of a population of 200 about one third are retired people, some have lived in the village all their lives, and others have retired from cities and towns. Unemployment is relatively low, and of the working population only about a third work in the village, the others working in the nearby towns of Newmarket, Haverhill and Bury St Edmunds. Some people are self-employed, working in or around the village. The average size of family is 2 children and as there is no school in the village, the children from 5-8 years go to Wickhambrook Primary school, the 9-13 years to Newmarket and older ones to either Newmarket or Bury St Edmunds. There is also a playgroup in Wickhambrook which some 3-5 year olds attend.
